flawed_nl_solution:
Between the trolley driver and his first 10 customers, there are 1+10 = <<1+10=16>>16 people are currently on the trolley
On his first stop, 10 people go on and twice as many people got on at the second stop so 10*2 = <<10*2=20>>20 people got on at the second stop.
So at the second stop he had 16 people on board, 3 got off and 20 got on so he now has 16-3+20 = <<16-3+20=33>>33 people
At his third stop 18 people got off and 2 got on so in total there are 33-18 +2 = <<33-18+2=17>>17 people on the trolley
#### 17

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 11, not 16. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
